comments.text: It appears that Yahoo currently has three email services: Classic, Yahoo Mail (which will be removed in July), and the new Yahoo Mail (which is the default for new users). I used to use Yahoo Mail and that's what the above bug is about. I just switched to the new Yahoo Mail. Now Firefox's 'Send To' feature has completely stopped working; I don't even get a message window, I'm just sent to the Yahoo Mail main page. The same happens with all mailto: links: they send me to the Yahoo Mail main page. Yahoo must have changed their URL scheme.
comments.author: axelboldt@yahoo.com

comments.raw_text:
Investigating further, in Firefox under Option/Applications/mailto I see *two* entries labeled "Use Yahoo! Mail", one of them has the purple Yahoo logo in front. That is the one I used for the above bug reports. I now switched to the other Yahoo mailto handler (and I'm still on the new Yahoo Mail). The mailto: links work now, but the bug cutting off everything after a question mark is still there. 

For instance, if I use 'Send Link...' on this bugzilla page, I'm being sent to the URL 

http://de.mg4.mail.yahoo.com/neo/launch?.rand=656903824&action=compose&To=mailto:?body=https%3A%2F%2Fbugzilla.mozilla.org%2Fshow_bug.cgi%3Fid%3D662952&subject=Bug%20662952%20%E2%80%93%20'Send%20Link'%20chops%20off%20everything%20in%20the%20URL%20after%20question%20mark

which opens an email message window with the subject "Bug 662952 –" and the message text "https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi". The latter is not turned into a link. This is shown in the attached screenshot.
comments.author: axelboldt@yahoo.com
